 14#define VSIP_OPT_SIGNAL_CORR_EXT_HPP

 37  Declarations
 38***********************************************************************/

 40namespace vsip
 41{
 42namespace impl
 43{
 44
 45template <dimension_type      D,
 46	  support_region_type Supp,
 47	  typename            T,
 48	  unsigned            n_times,
 49          alg_hint_type       a_hint>
 50class Correlation
 51{
 52  static dimension_type const dim = D;
 53
 54  // Compile-time constants.
 55public:
 56  static support_region_type const supprt  = Supp;
 57
 58  // Constructors, copies, assignments, and destructors.
 59public:
 60  Correlation(Domain<dim> const&   ref_size,
 61              Domain<dim> const&   input_size)
 62    VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
 63  : ref_size_   (normalize(ref_size)),
 64    input_size_ (normalize(input_size)),
 65    output_size_(conv_output_size(Supp, ref_size_, input_size_, 1)),
 66    in_buffer_(input_size_.size()),
 67    out_buffer_(output_size_.size()),
 68    ref_buffer_(ref_size_.size())
 69  {}
 70  Correlation(Correlation const&) VSIP_NOTHROW;
 71  Correlation& operator=(Correlation const&) VSIP_NOTHROW;
 72  ~Correlation() VSIP_NOTHROW {}
 73
 74  // Accessors.
 75public:
 76  Domain<dim> const& reference_size() const VSIP_NOTHROW  { return ref_size_; }
 77  Domain<dim> const& input_size() const VSIP_NOTHROW   { return input_size_; }
 78  Domain<dim> const& output_size() const VSIP_NOTHROW  { return output_size_; }
 79
 80  float impl_performance(char* what) const
 81  {
 82    if (!strcmp(what, "in_ext_cost"))       return pm_in_ext_cost_;
 83    else if (!strcmp(what, "out_ext_cost")) return pm_out_ext_cost_;
 84    else return 0.f;
 85  }
 86
 87  // Implementation functions.
 88public:
 89  template <typename Block0,
 90	    typename Block1,
 91	    typename Block2>
 92  void
 93  impl_correlate(bias_type bias,
 94                 const_Vector<T, Block0> ref,
 95                 const_Vector<T, Block1> in,
 96                 Vector<T, Block2>       out)
 97    VSIP_NOTHROW;
 98
 99  template <typename Block0,
100	    typename Block1,
101	    typename Block2>
102  void
103  impl_correlate(bias_type bias,
104                 const_Matrix<T, Block0> ref,
105                 const_Matrix<T, Block1> in,
106                 Matrix<T, Block2>       out)
107    VSIP_NOTHROW;
108
109  // Member data.
110private:
111  Domain<dim>     ref_size_;
112  Domain<dim>     input_size_;
113  Domain<dim>     output_size_;
114
115  aligned_array<T> in_buffer_;
116  aligned_array<T> out_buffer_;
117  aligned_array<T> ref_buffer_;
118
119  size_t          pm_ref_ext_cost_;
120  size_t          pm_in_ext_cost_;
121  size_t          pm_out_ext_cost_;
122};
123
124
125
126/***********************************************************************
127  Definitions
128***********************************************************************/
129
130// Perform 1-D correlation.
131
132template <dimension_type      D,
133	  support_region_type Supp,
134	  typename            T,
135	  unsigned            n_times,
136          alg_hint_type       a_hint>
137template <typename Block0,
138	  typename Block1,
139	  typename Block2>
140void
141Correlation<D, Supp, T, n_times, a_hint>::impl_correlate(
142  bias_type               bias,
143  const_Vector<T, Block0> ref,
144  const_Vector<T, Block1> in,
145  Vector<T, Block2>       out)
146VSIP_NOTHROW
147{
148  length_type const M = this->ref_size_[0].size();
149  length_type const N = this->input_size_[0].size();
150  length_type const P = this->output_size_[0].size();
151
152  assert(M == ref.size());
153  assert(N == in.size());
154  assert(P == out.size());
155
156  // PROFILE: Warn if arguments are not entirely on single processor
157  // (either as undistributed views or as local views of distr obj).
158
159  typedef typename Block_layout<Block0>::layout_type LP0;
160  typedef typename Block_layout<Block1>::layout_type LP1;
161  typedef typename Block_layout<Block2>::layout_type LP2;
162
163  typedef Layout<1, Any_type, Any_type, Cmplx_inter_fmt> req_LP;
164
165  typedef typename Adjust_layout<T, req_LP, LP0>::type use_LP0;
166  typedef typename Adjust_layout<T, req_LP, LP1>::type use_LP1;
167  typedef typename Adjust_layout<T, req_LP, LP2>::type use_LP2;
168
169  typedef Ext_data_dist<Block0, SYNC_IN,  use_LP0> ref_ext_type;
170  typedef Ext_data_dist<Block1, SYNC_IN,  use_LP1> in_ext_type;
171  typedef Ext_data_dist<Block2, SYNC_OUT, use_LP2> out_ext_type;
172
173  ref_ext_type ref_ext(ref.block(), ref_buffer_.get());
174  in_ext_type  in_ext (in.block(),  in_buffer_.get());
175  out_ext_type out_ext(out.block(), out_buffer_.get());
176
177  pm_ref_ext_cost_ += ref_ext.cost();
178  pm_in_ext_cost_  += in_ext.cost();
179  pm_out_ext_cost_ += out_ext.cost();
180
181  T* pref   = ref_ext.data();
182  T* pin    = in_ext.data();
183  T* pout   = out_ext.data();
184
185  stride_type s_ref = ref_ext.stride(0);
186  stride_type s_in  = in_ext.stride(0);
187  stride_type s_out = out_ext.stride(0);
188
189  if (Supp == support_full)
190  {
191    corr_full<T>(bias, pref, M, s_ref, pin, N, s_in, pout, P, s_out);
192  }
193  else if (Supp == support_same)
194  {
195    corr_same<T>(bias, pref, M, s_ref, pin, N, s_in, pout, P, s_out);
196  }
197  else // (Supp == support_min)
198  {
199    corr_min<T>(bias, pref, M, s_ref, pin, N, s_in, pout, P, s_out);
200  }
201}
202
203
204
205// Perform 2-D correlation.
206
207template <dimension_type      D,
208	  support_region_type Supp,
209	  typename            T,
210	  unsigned            n_times,
211          alg_hint_type       a_hint>
212template <typename Block0,
213	  typename Block1,
214	  typename Block2>
215void
216Correlation<D, Supp, T, n_times, a_hint>::impl_correlate(
217  bias_type               bias,
218  const_Matrix<T, Block0> ref,
219  const_Matrix<T, Block1> in,
220  Matrix<T, Block2>       out)
221VSIP_NOTHROW
222{
223  using vsip::impl::Any_type;
224
225  length_type const Mr = this->ref_size_[0].size();
226  length_type const Mc = this->ref_size_[1].size();
227  length_type const Nr = this->input_size_[0].size();
228  length_type const Nc = this->input_size_[1].size();
229  length_type const Pr = this->output_size_[0].size();
230  length_type const Pc = this->output_size_[1].size();
231
232  assert(Mr == ref.size(0));
233  assert(Mc == ref.size(1));
234  assert(Nr == in.size(0));
235  assert(Nc == in.size(1));
236  assert(Pr == out.size(0));
237  assert(Pc == out.size(1));
238
239  // PROFILE: Warn if arguments are not entirely on single processor
240  // (either as undistributed views or as local views of distr obj).
241
242  typedef typename Block_layout<Block0>::layout_type LP0;
243  typedef typename Block_layout<Block1>::layout_type LP1;
244  typedef typename Block_layout<Block2>::layout_type LP2;
245
246  typedef Layout<2, Any_type, Any_type, Cmplx_inter_fmt> req_LP;
247
248  typedef typename Adjust_layout<T, req_LP, LP0>::type use_LP0;
249  typedef typename Adjust_layout<T, req_LP, LP1>::type use_LP1;
250  typedef typename Adjust_layout<T, req_LP, LP2>::type use_LP2;
251
252  typedef Ext_data_dist<Block0, SYNC_IN,  use_LP0> ref_ext_type;
253  typedef Ext_data_dist<Block1, SYNC_IN,  use_LP1> in_ext_type;
254  typedef Ext_data_dist<Block2, SYNC_OUT, use_LP2> out_ext_type;
255
256  ref_ext_type ref_ext(ref.block(), ref_buffer_.get());
257  in_ext_type  in_ext (in.block(),  in_buffer_.get());
258  out_ext_type out_ext(out.block(), out_buffer_.get());
259
260  pm_ref_ext_cost_ += ref_ext.cost();
261  pm_in_ext_cost_  += in_ext.cost();
262  pm_out_ext_cost_ += out_ext.cost();
263
264  T* p_ref   = ref_ext.data();
265  T* p_in    = in_ext.data();
266  T* p_out   = out_ext.data();
267
268  stride_type ref_row_stride = ref_ext.stride(0);
269  stride_type ref_col_stride = ref_ext.stride(1);
270  stride_type in_row_stride  = in_ext.stride(0);
271  stride_type in_col_stride  = in_ext.stride(1);
272  stride_type out_row_stride = out_ext.stride(0);
273  stride_type out_col_stride = out_ext.stride(1);
274
275  if (Supp == support_full)
276  {
277    corr_full<T>(bias,
278		 p_ref, Mr, Mc, ref_row_stride, ref_col_stride,
279		 p_in, Nr, Nc, in_row_stride, in_col_stride,
280		 p_out, Pr, Pc, out_row_stride, out_col_stride);
281  }
282  else if (Supp == support_same)
283  {
284    corr_same<T>(bias,
285		 p_ref, Mr, Mc, ref_row_stride, ref_col_stride,
286		 p_in, Nr, Nc, in_row_stride, in_col_stride,
287		 p_out, Pr, Pc, out_row_stride, out_col_stride);
288  }
289  else // (Supp == support_min)
290  {
291    corr_min<T>(bias,
292		p_ref, Mr, Mc, ref_row_stride, ref_col_stride,
293		p_in, Nr, Nc, in_row_stride, in_col_stride,
294		p_out, Pr, Pc, out_row_stride, out_col_stride);
295  }
296}
297} // namespace vsip::impl
298} // namespace vsip
299
300namespace vsip_csl
301{
302namespace dispatcher
303{
304template <dimension_type      D,
305          support_region_type R,
306          typename            T,
307	  unsigned            N,
308          alg_hint_type       H>
309struct Evaluator<op::corr<D, R, T, N, H>, be::generic>
310{
311  static bool const ct_valid = true;
312  typedef vsip::impl::Correlation<D, R, T, N, H> backend_type;
313};
314} // namespace vsip_csl::dispatcher
315} // namespace vsip_csl

317#endif // VSIP_OPT_SIGNAL_CORR_EXT_HPP
